[Hamath and Arpad,] cities of Aram, [are shamed,] for they heard bad news concerning Damascus, which is the head of Aram, as it is stated.“For the head of Aram is Damascus” (Isa. 7:8). Therefore, they melted.

text.title: there is worry in the sea:

pasuk.text: He compares her worry to the worry of the sea, which cannot be quiet. Every instance of דאגה, worry, is an expression of fear.
Her hands have become too feeble to wage war.
Heb. רֶטֶט.

It was not filled with earth around its wall to strengthen the wall. Cf.“And they fortified (ויעזבוּ) Jerusalem up to the wall” (Neh. 3:8). It can also be interpreted: Why was it not forsaken by this evil, that the evil should not come upon it?
So shall her king mourn over her.
This is an expression of an oath.
Heb. ידמו, [lit. shall be silent,] shall be destroyed, but it does not deviate from being an expression of silence, for in every ruined city, no voice is heard.
They were desert dwellers, with neither wall nor city.
Heb. מגור (amassment in French). Another explanation: an expression of fear.
And what was that counsel?“Rise and go up to a peaceful nation.”
Confidently alone. They need not gather and dwell among people, for they fear not that an enemy will come upon them.
Separated from one end to the other end of the directions.
The might of Elam (other editions: the strength of Elam).
The best of their might.

text.title: And I will place My throne:

pasuk.text: My siege (מָצוֹר).
(Perche in French.) That is a signal for gathering.
The names of the Babylonian deities.
[viz.] Persia and Media.
Toward this place, Jerusalem, they shall direct their faces when Babylon will be destroyed and they will leave it with the sanction of Cyrus, king of Persia.

text.title: their shepherds caused them to stray:

pasuk.text: Their kings caused them to stray away from Me.
To the mountains, to the idol worship that was on the mountains. שׁוֹבְבוּם (esvayent in O.F.), led astray, their kings led them astray. And Jonathan rendered: their governors plundered them.

text.title: and the hope of their forefathers:

pasuk.text: Jonathan renders: וְסִבּוּר אֲבָהָתְהוֹן, and the hope of their forefathers.
Accordingly, go out of there.

text.title: like the he goats before the flocks:

pasuk.text: It is customary for the he-goats to go before the flock, at the head of the she-goats.

text.title: and they shall set themselves in array against her:

pasuk.text: They shall array themselves in battle against her.
Heb. שֹּׁסֵי.
Heb. תפושו, an expression of fat.
Heb. דשא, a heifer that threshes the grain and eats constantly.
Your nation.
Although your beginning was great, your end will be a desert.
Heb. ידו, cast stones at her. Cf.“And they cast (וידוּ) stones at me” (Lam. 3:53).
like a person who has no strength and stretches forth his hand to whomever he sees, to beg mercy and aid. Cf. We gave our hand to Egypt" (Lam. 5:6).

Heb. אשיותיה. The strength of her foundations. Cf.“And the foundations (וְאֻשַּׁיָא) shall be fastened” (Ezra 4:12). And in the language of the Mishnah: Those who dig for foundations (לְאֻשִׁין) [Baba Kamma 50a]. Cf.“And strengthen yourselves (והתאוששוּ)” (Isa. 46:8), equivalent to והתחזקוּ, and strengthen yourselves.
to the city of the Lord.
Destroy a king from Babylon and one who grasps a sword in time of slaughter.
For he exiled the Ten Tribes.
He broke his bones, for he finished the leftovers, Judah and Benjamin. עִצְמוֹ (desossa in French), [broke the bones].

text.title: and he shall pasture in the Carmel:

pasuk.text: An expression of pasture.
Heb. מרתים, which rebelled against Me and provoked Me.
The name of a province. Cf.“Pekod and Shoa and Koa” (Ezekiel 23:23). Jonathan renders [them as] names of provinces.

text.title: and do according to all that I have commanded you:

pasuk.text: You, Cyrus, through Isaiah the prophet.

text.title: the hammer of the whole earth:

pasuk.text: which would shatter and crush everyone.

text.title: I laid a snare for you:

pasuk.text: Heb. יקשתי, an expression of a snare (מוֹקֵש).

text.title: Come against her from her border:

pasuk.text: From the end of the city, commence upon her, that she not know, and she will be taken suddenly.
Jonathan renders: אִבּוּלָהָא, her gates, but it has no similar instance [in Scripture]. Menahem (Machbereth p. 14) classifies it as an expression of a manger.
Heb. סלוה.
Granaries.
Her princes. So is the custom of the prophets to compare the princes to mighty bulls and to he-goats.

Heb. השמיעו, an expression similar to: “And Saul called the people together (וַיְשַׁמַע) ” (I Sam. 15:4). Call out that archers assemble against Babylon. Cf.“His archers (רַבָּיו) surround me” (Job 16:13).
An expression of an oath.

text.title: in order to give rest to the earth:

pasuk.text: When Babylon falls, there will be rest and peace for all.
Heb. הבדים, to her diviners.

with their divining. Similar to this is: “Who frustrates the signs of imposters” (Isa. 44:25), and so did Jonathan render. They are called בּדים because they fabricate (בּוֹדִים) and say false things.
Heb. הערב. Jonathan renders: סוּמְכותא (garantie in French).

text.title: and they are mad upon things of horror:

pasuk.text: Heb. יתהללו, they shall become mad. Another interpretation: (Pour vanter in French) in order to boast. And so did Jonathan render: משתבּחין, they boast, [i.e.,] with the gods of the giants that they had.
Jonathan [renders]: And martens shall meet cats. [These are] species of animals found in ruins.

that ascends from the heights of the Jordan, so will the spoiler come to the strong dwelling. So did Jonathan paraphrase: Behold a king with his camp shall ascend upon them like a lion that ascends from the height of the Jordan. We learn that the height of the Jordan is a place of lions. Also, in this manner Jonathan renders: “How will you do in the heights of the Jordan” (12:5): Against the wild beasts of the heights of the Jordan.
Heb. ארגיעה, when I bring the time.
Heb. מעליה.

text.title: and who will appoint Me a time:

pasuk.text: for war?
Persia, the youngest of the sons of Japheth.
Casdim (Chaldeans) according to cypher of ‘At- bash’ (א -תב ש).
The desire of the king of Persia and Media, who is a destroyer. Heb. רוּחַ (talent in O.F.).
Heb. וְזֵרוּהָ.
Heb. וִיבֹקְקוּ.
This is an elliptical verse. [The meaning is:] To wherever I say, there the archer shall bend his bow.

text.title: and he shall not be healed with his coat of mail:

pasuk.text: Heb. יִתְעַל וְאַל.
He has not forgotten him to avenge him.
of the Chaldeans.
Israel, from within Babylon.
Until now, Babylon was [a golden cup] in the Lord’s hand with which to intoxicate the whole earth with the wine of wrath.
They have become drunk and have become mad.

text.title: her judgment has touched the sky:

pasuk.text: Their retribution has reached high up to the sky.

text.title: “The Lord has brought forth our merits”:

pasuk.text: We have been remembered by Him favorably, and the merits of our forefathers have come before Him.
Heb. הברו, an expression of cleaning.
Heb. השלטים, the quivers into which the arrows are placed.
already many days.
His plan. It is customary for Scripture to speak with the word גַם twice, one after the other, and following the latter, comes the former.
Heb. קצך, your end.
Heb. אַמַתבִּצְעֵ, the measure of your violence. Another explanation: אַמַתבִּצְעֵ means: the measure of your end. Cf.“When… completes (יִבַצַע)” (Isa. 10:12).
(en soi meme in French.)
Heb. כי אם, an expression of ‘in truth.’

text.title: I have… filled you with men:

pasuk.text: I will fill you with camps of peoples, as many as locusts.

text.title: and they shall raise a battle-cry against you:

pasuk.text: And they shall raise their voice against you.
[i.e.,] whoever makes a graven image for a god.
[As translated], an expression [denoting] molten images.

text.title: at the time of their visitation:

pasuk.text: When the Holy One, blessed be He, visits retribution upon them and upon their worshippers.

text.title: and the tribe of His inheritance:

pasuk.text: Jacob mentioned above at the beginning of the verse.
Heb. מפץ. Until now, I have appointed you as a destroyer and a shatterer of the nations upon whom I decreed exile.
After all this, when I complete My vengeance upon the nations through him.
Heb. קַדְשוֹ.
Heb. טפסר, an expression of an army [or an expression of a lord].
Heb. סמר. (Herisse in French), covered with spikes. Cf.“It made the hair of my flesh stand up like spikes (תְּסַּמֵר)” (Job 4:15).
Heb. ותחל, an expression of חַלְחָלָה pain.
Heb. נשתה, [lit.] jumped. Compare “the hip sinew (הנשה)” (Gen. 33:32), so called because it jumped [was dislocated] from its place.

text.title: is like a granary at the time it is threshed:

pasuk.text: Behold, now it is full, like a granary at the time they have threshed its grain, when it is full of wheat.
and she shall he emptied and shall resemble a granary at the time of the beginning of the harvest, when it is empty.

text.title: the plundering done me and my food:

pasuk.text: The cry of violence done me and my food, for they have eaten my food.
Heb. נערו, an expression of a braying (נוֹעֵר) donkey.

text.title: in their heat, I will place their wine feasts:

pasuk.text: I will intend that their wine feasts shall be in the hot season so that they become drunk.

text.title: in order that they become joyful and sleep:

pasuk.text: Heb. וישנו, and sleep soundly.

Heb. שנתעולם, a perpetual sleep, and so it happened to them; out of their wine feast and drunkenness they were destroyed and slain, and the city was captured, as it is written in Daniel (5:2): “Belshazzar said while he tasted the wine, etc.” ; (5: 4), “They drank wine, etc.” ; (5:30), “On that night, Belshazzar, the king of the Chaldeans, was slain” ; (6:1), “And Darius the Mede received the kingship.”
Heb. כברים, lambs (and Jonathan renders:) like bulls.
Babylon in the ‘At- bash’ (א -תב ש), cipher.

text.title: The sea has ascended upon Babylon:

pasuk.text: A huge army, like the waters of [the sea].
On the deity of Babylon.
That all the inhabitants of the land were humbled under him.
Heb. יהרו, and shall not gather. Cf.“And all the nations shall stream (ונהרוּ) to it” (Isa. 2:2). Like the waters of the river, all of which go to the sea.

text.title: because of the rumor that is heard in the land:

pasuk.text: This rumor concerning Belshazzar that he was slain.

text.title: for a rumor shall come one year:

pasuk.text: In that very year there will come a rumor that Babylon has been destroyed by itself from heaven as it is stated: “And Babylon, the beauty of the kingdoms the glory of the pride of the Chaldee, shall be like God’s overturning of Sodom and Gemorrah” (Isa. 13: 19).

text.title: and after it in a year:

pasuk.text: [In] the second [year].
that is good for you [viz.] “So said Cyrus, the king of Persia…, Whoever among you of all His people…” (Ezra 1:2f).

text.title: and one ruler upon another ruler:

pasuk.text: Darius the Mede reigned one year, and in the second year Cyrus the Persian.
was [a cause] for the slain of Israel to fall therein.
shall fall the slain of all her land.
Israel, who was exiled into her midst, who escaped the sword of Nebuzaradan.
For the Chaldeans were saying and reproaching us, saying, “The hand of our god is exalted for we have destroyed His house.”
Heb. יאנק. The mortally wounded shall cry. When they kill a person with an arrow or with a spear, and he groans when they remove the spear, that is אנקה.
Heb. תבצר, an expression of a strong fortress.

text.title: from Me shall spoilers come upon her:

pasuk.text: From Me, from the heavens that are higher than she, shall the spoilers come upon her.

text.title: the stirring of their voice was uttered:

pasuk.text: The sound of their cry is heard.
Heb. תתערער, an expression of digging. An expression like “Dig under it, dig under it (עָרוּ), until its foundation” (Psalms 137:7).
For much futility which it will bring upon them.
